body:
To get a sense for how to refactor existing streams for these changes, see this PR:

https://github.com/w2ogroup/streams-examples/pull/3
latest push addresses all feedback and adds two tests

```
Tests run: 92, Failures: 4, Errors: 72, Skipped: 1
Failed tests: 
  DatumStatusCounterTest.testConstructor:59->Assert.fail:88 Constructor Threw Exception : javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException: org.apache.streams.local:type=DatumCounter,name=test_id,identifier=Unknown_Stream,startedAt=-1
  StreamsTaskCounterTest.testConstructor:57->Assert.fail:88 Constructor threw error : javax.management.InstanceAlreadyExistsException: org.apache.streams.local:type=StreamsTaskCounter,name=test_id,identifier=null,startedAt=-1
  ThroughputQueueSingleThreadTest.testMultipleMBeanRegistrations:238->Assert.fail:88 Failed to register MXBean : Format specifier 's'
  ThroughputQueueSingleThreadTest.testMBeanRegistration:217->Assert.fail:88 Failed to register MXBean : Format specifier 's'

Tests in error: 
  LocalStreamBuilderTest.testBasicLinearStream1:132->linearStreamNonParallel:183->removeRegisteredMBeans:93 » MissingFormatArgument
  LocalStreamBuilderTest.testStreamIdValidations:110 » NullPointer
  LocalStreamBuilderTest.testBasicLinearStream2:137->linearStreamNonParallel:183->removeRegisteredMBeans:93 » MissingFormatArgument
  LocalStreamBuilderTest.testBasicMergeStream:246->removeRegisteredMBeans:93 » MissingFormatArgument
  LocalStreamBuilderTest.testParallelLinearStream1:220->removeRegisteredMBeans:93 » MissingFormatArgument
...
```

There are failed test in your pull request.

Is it possible to include a constructor in GPlusUserDataProvider and GPlusUserActivityProvider which accepts a GPlusConfiguration object? Stream developers may want the option to manually specify certain configuration parameters
Could you mark these classes as deprecated?
I can, but until 218 merges they are still necessary to convert to Activity.

Ok then after this is merged would you merge master into 218 and mark them as deprecated there?

:+1:

In the GPlusUserActivityProvider and GPlusUserDataProvider, is there a reason you are creating a StreamsDatum with the String value of the objects instead of an Activity/Person object? I believe the standard is the latter in the rest of our providers

IMO all providers should have a option to emit unaltered json String, and that should be the default behavior.  Easy enough to add a processor to convert it to Activity or other Entity, but if that conversion is embedded within the Provider it's harder to get it back to its original form there-after.

This provider doesn't operate off of unaltered JSON String, though. It gets back G+'s Activity or Person objects (distinct from our own POJOS) We would therefore need to do the conversion step in the processor back to the appropriate object type (G+ Activity or Person) before it could be converted to a Stream's Activity

In that case I agree best practice would be to emit with a few modifications as possible (ideally zero) whatever came over the wire, leaving conversion to String to a follow-on step - in this case some TypeConverterProcessor with a String output
@robdouglas The GPlus Activity objects are not serializable.  Thats why I emitted as string instead.

Ok, issue is the TypeConverter is expecting either a G+ Activity or Person object, instead of a String. Is there no way to work around the serializability problem in the provider? If not, the TypeConverter can be modified to work with a String representation
@robdouglas org.apache.streams.jackson.TypeConverterProcessor should be able to convert from String json to any other jackson-compatible POJO using StreamsJacksonMapper.

In general, we need to ensure that all components and outbound datums are serializable without exception.  While it's possible to skirt this in the local runtime, modules that don't conform are unusable with parallelism > 1 or in any horizontally scalable runtime.

addressed all comments
renamed module to better reflect it's purpose

This PR depends on changes and new classes in 
https://github.com/apache/incubator-streams/pull/149
and
https://github.com/apache/incubator-streams/pull/148
so they must merge first.
:+1: , for now.  Lets make a ticket to change this in the future.  Instead of running a thread for each monitor, lets run 1 thread and each monitor on cadence through a scheduled executor.

Tests are failing in my build after I merged this.

Tests in error:
  LocalStreamBuilderTest.testBasicLinearStreamRandom {#0 seed=[A5879A79A8A52736:FF750F9AA6A3C8CB]} » ThreadLeak
  LocalStreamBuilderTest.testBasicLinearStreamRandom {#0 seed=[A5879A79A8A52736:FF750F9AA6A3C8CB]} » ThreadLeak
  LocalStreamBuilderTest.org.apache.streams.local.builders.LocalStreamBuilderTest » ThreadLeak
  LocalStreamBuilderTest.org.apache.streams.local.builders.LocalStreamBuilderTest » ThreadLeak

Appears to be the same sort of issues that cropped up in 
https://github.com/apache/incubator-streams/pull/140

Would someone please replicate the failure or document their local configuration where all tests pass?
@steveblackmon, I pulled down the latest code from master and did not get those errors while building. Can anyone else reproduce? @rbnks?
master is blue, master + robdouglas/STREAMS-252 mvn clean install is failing for me locally.
A test is failing in a module not related to your pull request.  I need to solve this before i can merge your pull request.

:+1: no idea how this was merged. scanning the class path with each datum would be bad, let alone each datum for each iteration in the stream. wowza!

I propose that we figure out a way to time tests to see if there is a significant performance degradation in on the integration tests to avoid this issue in the future.

@steveblackmon  If you scan, you should only scan the classpath ONCE! Collect the classes that you want to use and never, ever, EVER scan the class-path, ever again.

Scanning a class-path is a terribly time consuming thing to do.
I suggest making the constructor protected.  That way external callers get an instance of the singleton via the getInstance() method and you are not scanning the classpath a ton of times.

@steveblackmon if the entire code base used getInstance() where appropriate then this wouldn't be as much of an issue. However, there are 34 instances in the code base where we're calling `new StreamsJacksonMapper()` which results in these gratuitous Reflections calls.
fair point.  i'll happily merge a PR that protects the constructor and refactors project source and tests to use the singleton.
I think that's a good call @steveblackmon. When do you think you'll be able to get around to that? If you've got some work built up then I can try and knock that out later today
working it - will push and PR as soon as tests pass

This feature is comprehensively tested by 
https://github.com/apache/incubator-streams-examples/blob/master/local/elasticsearch-reindex/src/test/java/org/apache/streams/example/elasticsearch/test/ElasticsearchReindexParentChildIT.java
merging without +1 to restore build status.  only imports are touched in this PR
merging to restore build.  no risk of negative impact to repositories and modules not touched by STREAMS-285 PRs
I will lazy consensus merge this in 48 hours.
I will lazy consensus merge this in 48 hours.

There's some good stuff in here, but I suspect you didn't really want all of it in the PR.

Please open a PR more appropriate to the scope of the story.  

Also, how about submitting the additional testing for es-persist?

:+1: This would be/is really helpful for processing document only streams on disk. 

I would add though that it'd be cool if it was a little bit more flexible maybe having the option of a user provided function or lambda to define how to process the files -- problem for another day though.
in https://github.com/apache/incubator-streams-examples/pull/5 there is an example of how to substitute a different version, as called for in the issue.
i'm deleting this branch so i can resolve the merge conflicts with a rebase
I will lazy consensus merge this in 48 hours.
I will lazy consensus merge this in 48 hours.

:+1: 

Note: formString conversions appear to be lost altogether with ActivityConverter model. The functionality is still there in a sense, but the code to do the same task is more verbose now.

You make a good point about the difficulty of running a multi-type conversion without the Processor.  I've broken out a helper class that will make it as easy to convert without the Processor as with a Processor.  All tests still pass.
